questions.question: Weakening the mixture below the best fuel/air ratio will cause the engine power to:
options: b. increase initially, but decrease below take off power
d. be unaffected by altitude increase

questions.question: For maximum endurance the mixture control should be set to:
An air/fuel ratio of 9:1 would be considered:
Because of the reduction in the density of the atmosphere associated with an increase in altitude:
options: a. the mixture control must be moved towards the weak position
b. the throttle must close progressively to maintain the best air/fuel ratio.
c. the mixture must be progressively richened to compensate for the power loss
d. the octane rating of the fuel must be increased

questions.question: While weakening the mixture from the chemically correct mixture the EGT will ...... and the cylinder head temperature will .......... with a ...... in thermal efficiency.
Which of the following mixtures theoretically would produce the maximum rpm?

options: a. The charge would be cooled due to a larger proportion of nitrogen in the cylinder
b. The charge would burn slower due to a larger proportion of nitrogen in the cylinder
c. The ignition may have to be advanced
d. The ignition may have to be retarded

questions.question: While using a rich mixture which of the following would be a correct statement?
options: a. The charge would burn slower
b. All of the fuel would be used during combustion
c. All of the oxygen would be used during combustion
d. Cylinder head temperature increases while richening further
